title: (MAC) League Not Opening
body:
I've tried plenty of things to try and get my League back up and running but nothing has worked for me yet (inb4 first reply works).

Basically, when I start up League, the logo shows up but then sits there for a quite a while then says "Unspecified error occurred. Please check the logs for more information." Activity Monitor says that UserKernel is not responding if that adds anything to the discussion.

I tried deleting "lol_air_client" and "lol_air_client_config_oc1" from the RADS > projects folder and they're in my trash but starting League up again doesn't replace them or make it work. I also tried deleting the "solutions" folder in "RADS" as well and the same thing happened, except it was replaced by an empty "solutions" folder.

If anybody has any suggestions I could try to get League working again, that'd be great,

Thanks, Nineflames

replies.body:
Well... there you go. I should've searched more extensively, sorry.

I saw this - http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/8b0EJ8nP-mac-wont-open-dec-3-2014-fix

and it worked like a charm for anybody else having the same problem.

Thanks, Nineflames

Scrap that, it opened the patcher and everything seemed fine and it stayed at 0% so I just assumed my internet was slow but it stays at 0% saying "Calculating differences | 1 Files Scanned"

I attempted to repair the patcher but it just crashes instead...

Any ideas?

Thanks, Nineflames
